lines.content: This program is written to keep track of upcoming events, deadlines or any tasks to complete. You can mark a task as done, delete it from the list and find tasks with a keyword.
Here is a user guide to teach you how to use this program.
When you run the program(FinalLevel), you should see
What can I do for you?
you can type your command and Duke will help you
### 1. list : list to show all your tasks to do
### 2.  done : mark a task as done
Nice! I've marked this task as done:
### 3. todo : (things to do) create a todo task
Got it. I've added this task:
Now you have 3 tasks in the list.
Now you have 2 tasks in the list.
### 5. find ：find all the tasks containing this keyword
Here are the matching tasks in your list:
### 6. deadline : set a deadline task which needs to be done by a certain time
Got it. I've added this task:
Now you have 1 tasks in the list.
### 7. event: set an event task which will happen at a certain time
Got it. I've added this task:
Now you have 2 tasks in the list.
### 8. bye ： quit the program and save the task into a text file "duke.txt"
Bye. Hope to see you again soon!
What is inside brackets should be the input format!
When you run the program(FinalLevel), you should see

you can type your command and Duke will help you
1. list : list to show all your tasks to do

3. todo :(things to do) create a todo task

5. find (keyword) find all the tasks containing this keyword
Here are the matching tasks in your list:
6. deadline : set a deadline task which needs to be done by a certain time
Got it. I've added this task:

7. event: set an event task which will happen at a certain time
Got it. I've added this task:
Now you have 2 tasks in the list.
8. bye  quit the program and save the task into a text file "duke.txt"
Bye. Hope to see you again soon!
What is inside brackets should be the input format!
* Represents a command. A Command object corresponds to
* a command represented by a String and a task object
* Represents a Deadline which extends Task class. A Deadline object corresponds to
* a Deadline represented by two Strings
* Represents a Delete which extends Command class. A Delete object corresponds to
* a Delete represented by a String and a list of Tasks
* implements performCommand() to delete a task from ArrayList<Task></Task>
* Represents a Delete which extends Command class. A Delete object corresponds to
* a Delete represented by a String and a list of Tasks
* implements performCommand() to mark a task from ArrayList<Task> as done
int taskNumberCompleted = Integer.parseInt(this.command.replaceAll("\\D+", "")) - 1; //find the corresponding index of done task
task.set(taskNumberCompleted, task.get(taskNumberCompleted).completeTask());// set the corresponding task as done
return super.task; //return task ArrayList after setting corresponding task to done
/** Duke class which contains all the methods needed */
public static String input; //input is for each statement input
public static ArrayList<Task> task = new ArrayList<Task>(); // create an arrayList to store tasks
public static File data = new File("duke.txt"); //Create file object
public static Scanner in = new Scanner(System.in);
* Main method to deal with the input and call corresponding methods
* @throws IOException  If the text file is not found.
public static void main(String[] args) throws IOException {
greet(); // call greet() method to greet
input = getNextStatement(); // get the input statement to execute.
/** to find tasks containing a certain keyword*/
else{ //dealing with undefined type of input
System.out.println("  OOPS!!! I'm sorry, but I don't know what that means :-(\n");
input = getNextStatement(); // get next input statement
write(task,data); //call write method to write list into txt file.
bye(); // call bye() method to say bye
* exceptionHandling() is to deal with all the potential exceptions
System.out.println(" OOPS!!! The description of a todo cannot be empty.");
System.out.println(" OOPS!!! The description of a deadline cannot be empty.");
System.out.println(" OOPS!!! The description of a event cannot be empty.");
* printList() is to print out all the tasks in the ArrayList
List list = new List(input,task); //create a new List object
* doneTask() is to mark a Task at the certain position as done
int taskNumberCompleted = Integer.parseInt(input.replaceAll("\\D+", "")) - 1; //find the corresponding index of done task
Done done = new Done(input,task); //create a new Done object
System.out.println(" Nice! I've marked this task as done:");
* deleteTask() is to delete a Task at the certain position
int taskNumberdeleted = Integer.parseInt(input.replaceAll("\\D+", "")) - 1; //find the corresponding index of task to be deleted
Delete delete = new Delete(input,task);//create a new Delete object
System.out.println("Now you have " + task.size() + " tasks in the list. ");
* findKeyword() is to find all the Tasks containing a user-input
*  keyword and print all the Tasks following certain format
System.out.println("Here are the matching tasks in your list:\n");
Find find = new Find(input,task);   //create a new Find object
* createTodo() is to create a Todo Task
Todo todo = new Todo(input); // create a todo object
task.add(todo); // add it to the arrayList
System.out.println("Got it. I've added this task: ");
System.out.println("Now you have " + task.size() + " tasks in the list. ");
* createEvent() is to create an Event Task
descriptionOfevent = input.substring(6, (input.indexOf("/") - 1)); //get content of event description
Event event = new Event(descriptionOfevent, at); //create a new event object with description and time
System.out.println("Got it. I've added this task: ");
System.out.println("Now you have " + task.size() + " tasks in the list. ");
* createDeadline() is to create a Deadline Task
descriptionOfDeadline = input.substring(9, (input.indexOf("/") - 1)); //get content of deadline description
Deadline ddl = new Deadline(descriptionOfDeadline, by); //create a new deadline object with description and time
System.out.println("Got it. I've added this task: ");
System.out.println("Now you have " + task.size() + " tasks in the list. ");
* Write all the tasks in the ArrayList into the text file
* @param data text file to write into
* @throws IOException  If the text file is not found.
public static void write(ArrayList<Task> task, File data) throws IOException {
FileWriter writer = new FileWriter(data,false); //set append attribute to true so that it won't overwrite the file.
* getNextStatement() is to get the next line of input and pass it
if(sc.hasNextLine()){ //if can read input statement from txt file
input=in.nextLine(); //get input statement from user input
System.out.println(" What can I do for you?\n");
System.out.println("Bye. Hope to see you again soon!");
* Represents a Event which extends Task class. A Event object corresponds to
* a Event represented by two Strings
* Represents a Find which extends Command class. A Find object corresponds to
* a Find represented by two Strings
* its main method is to find the occurrence of a keyword and print the task containing the keyword
* implements performCommand() to find all tasks from ArrayList<Task>
keyword = this.command.substring(5); // to get the keyword string
/*iterate the task arrayList to find corresponding items*/
* Represents a List which extends Command class. A List object corresponds to
* a List represented by Two String
* its main method is to iterate the whole task ArrayList to print out every statement*/
* implements performCommand() to iterate all the tasks from ArrayList<Task>
System.out.println((i + 1) + ":" + (Deadline) task.get(i)); // print deadline task in its format
System.out.println((i + 1) + ":" + (Event) task.get(i)); // print event task in its format
System.out.println((i + 1) + ":" + (Todo) task.get(i)); // print todo task in its format
* Represents a Task . A Task object corresponds to
* a Task represented by a String and a boolean value
* Represents a Todo which extends Task class. A Todo object corresponds to
* a Todo represented by two Strings
